ABOUT GULF HARBORS YACHT CLUB
ABOUT GULF HARBORS YACHT CLUB
Gulf Harbors Yacht Club
welcomes all who would like to meet new friends, enjoy the outstanding view, partake in many different social events, support the community, and enjoy the best food and drinks in the area.
Our Purpose
For over fifty years, the Gulf Harbors Yacht Club has warmly welcomed everyone interested in boating events, dining in a friendly atmosphere, and meeting new friends. Boat ownership is not a requirement for joining Gulf Harbors Yacht Club; neither is living in the Gulf Harbors neighborhoods.
Gulf Harbors Yacht Club welcomes all.
Our History
On March 15, 1965, the Officers and Board of Directors of the Floramar Cruise Club, Inc. adopted a resolution to amend the Articles of Incorporation, changing the Club’s name to
Gulf Harbors Yacht Club, Inc.
The new organization received its charter on April 27, 1965 and was registered with Lloyds Registry on May 5, 1965.
The Club was commissioned on June 19, 1965 with Harry Cadenhead serving as its first commodore. The Club occupied a residential type building at #16 Floramar Terrace owned by the Lindrick Corp., a subsidiary of the Henry Crown & Co., Chicago, and developers of Gulf Harbors, from 1965 to 1973. Rent was $15.00 per month plus utilities. This building was demolished in 1973 to make way for construction of the Sea Castle condominiums.
Club meetings were held in the auditorium of Clearwater Federal Savings & Loan Assn. for a short time. Then meetings and parties took place in the Gulf Harbors Civic Association Building until 1978. In 1972, the Lindrick Corp. offered to donate a strip of land on the North Channel in the present Gulf Harbors Beach Club Estates area.
This offer was withdrawn early in 1975, and on April 7, 1975, the company gave the Club a letter of intent to conclude our final location on the North Channel at the west end of Marine Parkway in the Gulf Harbors Woodlands Community. At a regular meeting on May 10, 1976, the membership authorized the building committee, headed by Rear Commodore Harold R. Haney, to proceed with plans for the construction of a clubhouse on the new site. With the help of many officers and members, the building was completed and commissioned on February 12, 1978.
IOBG Chapter
The International Order of the Blue Gavel (IOBG) is an international organization made up of Past Commodores from qualified yacht clubs. Its primary mission is to promote the highest ideals of yachting; preserve yacht club customs and traditions; and provide social, educational and humanitarian programs. In doing so, it also recognizes past commodores from the international yachting community.
The IOBG is governed by an International Board of Directors, Regional Districts and local Chapters. All of Florida is
District 8
where the previous Director was Karen Shea from our GHYC. Karen also served as the South East Vice President and was instrumental in bringing into the fold of the IOBG the Hemmingway Yacht Club of Cuba. The current President of District 8 is Kathy Hockenberry, previously affiliated with the GHYC. Three past GHYC commodores have also led District 8: John Snow 1990, John Button 2001 and Joe King 2005.
Locally, our GHYC IOBG Chapter was chartered on October 10, 1982. The current president is Maria Reza, vice president Jeff Ruggiero, Secretary Bill Gilmore and Treasurer Karen Shea. The GHYC Chapter (11 members) meets six times a year and is responsible for the GHYC annual Change of Watch and the Commodore’s Ball.
The chapter has provided significant monetary support to the Club’s youth sailing camp, started and hosted for numerous years the GHYC Member(s) of the Year recognition program and has hosted numerous other events like the Pig Roast, Spaghetti Feast, fish fries and memorial events.
The Gulf Harbors Yacht Club offers reciprocity to all International Order of the Blue Gavel (IOBG) members with a valid membership card.

CHARITY SUPPORT
CHARITY SUPPORT
Members of the Gulf Harbors Yacht Club are active in community service, both in their private lives and as Club members. Each year, the Club is privileged to support one or more local charities with monetary donations.
We have been able to assist many charities, including:
Pasco Kids First
Fostering Hope
SPCA
Toys for Tots
Gulf Harbors Yacht Club is also a
Toys for Tots
collection site.  Historically, our members’ generosity has filled more than 4 overflowing boxes with toys and bicycles to support this important effort.
PACE Center for Girls
Annual Children’s Christmas Party
Another way Gulf Harbors Yacht Club gives back to the community. Area children are invited to join us for a Saturday lunch and meet Santa party, where carols are sung and Santa arrives by boat with presents for all.
One Community Now
St. Vincent de Paul Food Bank
We are very proud of our donations to the St. Vincent de Paul food bank.  Our contributions assist the charity in distributing food to local families in need.
The efforts of our
Anchorettes
makes much of this possible.

EVENT VENUE
EVENT VENUE
Event Venue
Gulf Harbors Yacht Club
offers the finest on-the-water din
ing and banquet facilities in the area. With the greatest view of the North Channel in New Port Richey, there is no better location for a lovely sunset wedding ceremony than on the grounds of Gulf Harbor Yacht Club.
The lounge area overlooks the beautiful North Channel with a screened lanai and lovely grounds. The perfect combination for outdoor ceremonies, complimented by the fabulous sunsets. The elegant dining room can accommodate up to 100 persons. Our dining room & lounge, together can accommodate 140. Our dance floor is perfect for the bride and groom’s first dance or for an anniversary waltz by the happy couple celebrating any number of years together.
Our talented chef and dedicated staff will work closely with you to ensure that your event will be as perfect as possible. Chef David is a graduate of
The Culinary Institute of America
and has been with GHYC for 10 years. Our Mixologist has been pouring our favorite drinks for 20 years and the waitstaff of 7 years will work to make your guests feel like members.
Our outstanding staff will make your plated dinners elegant and delicious.
